country needs to reform the national curriculum to stop future generations falling behind on the global stage. Michael Gove criticised the current guidelines on history teaching for failing to include key figures from British history. No Churchill, no Elizabeth II , no Gladstone, no Disraeli, no Florence Nightingale, no Horatio Nelson, he wrote.
